intro: Pelargonium caucalifolium subsp. caucalifolium, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The subspecies is distinguished by its broad, fleshy leaves and its ability to thrive in coastal climates.
